intro: Anchusa arvensis var. stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are clustered in dense spikes. Anchusa arvensis var. stricta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
